meanings.definition: A sudden strong feeling of excitement or fear; a thrill.
meanings.sent1: The roller coaster ride gave me frissons of excitement.
meanings.sent2: She felt frissons of fear when she heard a loud noise at night.
meanings.sent3: The cat chasing its tail seemed to cause frissons of amusement in the children.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist in the movie sent frissons of excitement through the audience.
meanings.sent5: The magician's performance was so captivating that it created frissons of excitement in the crowd.

meanings.definition: A brief moment of emotional excitement.
meanings.sent1: Winning the game filled him with frissons of joy.
meanings.sent2: The surprise party gave her frissons of happiness.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics caused frissons of amusement among the family.
meanings.sent4: The first snowfall of the season brought frissons of delight to the children.
meanings.sent5: The heartfelt speech at the wedding evoked frissons of emotion in the guests.
